snippet: Muhammad A. Salah said in his lawsuit that he was unable to open a bank account, get a job or donate to his mosque without government approval.
abstract: Suburban Chicago man Muhammad A Salah, who sued Treasury Department for keeping him on the government’s list of 'specially designated terrorists' since 1995, is removed from the list.
lead_paragraph: Muhammad A. Salah said in his lawsuit that he was unable to open a bank account, get a job or donate to his mosque without government approval.

headline.main: Man Removed From Terror Suspect List
headline.print_headline: Man Removed From Terror Suspect List
